title: The Pale King's Wake
description: Fifteen years ago, you survived a cult suicide pact. Or so you said. Now, someone knows the truth. A True Detective-style psychological thriller.

public_embed.title: üêä The Hunting Lodge
public_embed.description:
Louisiana. The air is thick enough to drown in. It smells of rot, sulfur, and cheap bourbon.

You've all returned to the scene of the crime. The Blackwood Hunting Lodge.

**The Ex-Cop** swirls his flask. He buried the evidence here 15 years ago.
**The Shrink** adjusts their glasses. They know exactly which trauma triggers to pull.
**The Fixer** cracks his knuckles. He remembers the violence. He liked it.
**The Heir** checks their phone. No signal. Just like before.

A single cassette tape sits on the table.
public_embed.captionOfImage: A decrepit wooden hunting lodge sinking into a swamp, spanish moss hanging from dead cypress trees, thick fog, sepia tone, gritty cinematic texture

public_embed.title: üìº The Recording
public_embed.description:
You press play. Statistical hiss, then a voice. *Your* voice, from 15 years ago.

*"We do this together. We bleed the King, we bury the bodies, and we never speak of it again."*

The tape clicks off.

Someone broke the pact. Someone talked.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Close up of an old dusty cassette player on a scarred wooden table, flies buzzing around it, high contrast noir lighting

public_embed.title: üì± Silent Vibrations
public_embed.description:
Phones light up in pockets. Private messages. Accusations.

Look at your teammates. Who looks guilty?
public_embed.captionOfImage: Four people sitting in a dark room looking at each other with suspicion, dramatic shadows obscuring their eyes

content.text:
üïµÔ∏è **Internal Monologue:**

The Fixer is twitchy. He's going to crack. If he does, you go to jail. Maybe you should put him down first.

üëä **Internal Monologue:**

The Heir is looking at you like you're trash. Like they did back then. Don't let them sell you out.

üí∞ **Internal Monologue:**

This stains your career. The Ex-Cop promised it was buried. He failed you.

üß† **Internal Monologue:**

Fascinating. The group dynamic is collapsing exactly as Father predicted. Watch them tear each other apart.

public_embed.title: üßπ Cleaning House
public_embed.description:
You can't trust each other, but you have work to do. The scene must be scrubbed.

**Team A (Ex-Cop & Fixer):** Go to the woods. Burn the old ritual effigies before a satellite picks them up.
**Team B (Shrink & Heir):** Go to the basement archives. Shred the ledger.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Two paths diverging in a swamp, one leading into dark dense woods, the other leading down into a concrete storm cellar

public_embed.title: üå≤ The Sticks
public_embed.description:
The woods are silent. Too silent.

You find the effigies. Stick figures made of driftwood and bone.

Wait. One of them is wearing a tie. **Your tie.** The one you bought last week.

"Someone's been watching us," the Fixer grunts.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Creepy stick figures hanging from trees in a swamp, wearing modern clothing, fog swirling

public_embed.title: üî• Fire and Dirt
public_embed.description:
You need to burn them. But the Fixer spots fresh disturbed earth nearby. Shaped like a shallow grave.

He points the shovel at the Ex-Cop. "Did you really bury them deep enough, Detective?"
public_embed.captionOfImage: A rusty shovel blade covered in fresh mud, pointed at the camera, tense confrontation

choices.label: Ignore it and burn the sticks

public_embed.title: üï≥Ô∏è Empty
public_embed.description:
You dig. Sweating. Panting.

The hole is empty.

"They're gone," the Ex-Cop whispers. "The bodies moved themselves."

Or someone moved them.
public_embed.captionOfImage: An empty muddy hole in the ground, rain filling it up, despair

public_embed.title: üî• Ashes to Ashes
public_embed.description:
The fire catches. The effigies scream as the sap boils. It sounds human.

You turn your back on the grave. Some things are better left buried.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Bonfire in the woods, distorting shadows, sparks flying up into the dark canopy

public_embed.title: üóÑÔ∏è Paper Trails
public_embed.description:
The basement smells of mildew and old secrets.

The Heir finds the ledger. It documents the bribes. The cover-ups.

But the Shrink finds something else. A VHS tape labeled **"Patient Session: The Heir - 2024"**.

That was yesterday.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Stacks of old VHS tapes and rotting cardboard boxes, a single tape labeled clearly in marker

public_embed.title: üì∫ To Play or Destroy?
public_embed.description:
The Heir lunges for the tape. "That's private!"

The Shrink holds it back. "Why were you recording sessions? Are you the leak?"
public_embed.captionOfImage: A hand clutching a VHS tape tightly, another hand reaching for it, conflict

public_embed.title: üìº The Leak
public_embed.description:
Static. Then the Heir's voice.

*"I can't take the guilt anymore. I'm going to the press. I'm going to tell them everything."*

The Heir freezes. "I... I changed my mind."

But now the Shrink knows.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Old CRT TV screen showing static noise in a dark room

public_embed.title: üôà Ignorance is Bliss
public_embed.description:
The Shrink smashes the tape. Spools of magnetic ribbon spill out like guts.

"We're a team," the Shrink says smoothly. "I protect your secrets. You protect mine."
public_embed.captionOfImage: Tangled magnetic tape on a concrete floor, destroyed plastic pieces

public_embed.title: ü•É Drink Up
public_embed.description:
Everyone converges in the living room.

The Fixer is covered in mud. The Heir looks pale.

Suddenly, the power cuts. The generator out back has died.

"I'll fix it," the Fixer growls. He heads out the back door.
"I need my meds," the Shrink mutters, heading to the bathroom.

The Ex-Cop and Heir are left alone in the dark.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Pitch black room with only the glowing embers of a cigarette visible

public_embed.title: ‚ö° The Fracture
public_embed.description:
Chaos reigns. The group splinters.

**The Fixer (Solo):** Goes to check the generator. Finds a trap.
**The Shrink (Solo):** Goes to the bathroom. Finds a new reality.
**The Conspirators (Ex-Cop & Heir):** Plotting in the dark.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Image fractured into three shards, each showing a different nightmare scenario

public_embed.title: üì¶ The Punishment Box
public_embed.description:
You step outside. WHAM. Something hits you.

You wake up crammed into a wooden box. It's buried in the earth. A breathing tube sticks up.

This is the old punishment box. You used to put pledges in here.

The air is running out.
public_embed.captionOfImage: First person view of wooden planks inches from face, dirt falling through cracks, claustrophobic

public_embed.title: ü©∏ Freedom hurts
public_embed.description:
SNAP. The pain is blinding. But your hand slides free.

You claw your way out of the dirt, gasping for air.

You're alive. And you know who put you there. It wasn't a ghost.
public_embed.captionOfImage: A bloody hand bursting out of grave soil into the moonlight

public_embed.title: ‚ò†Ô∏è No One is Coming
public_embed.description:
You scream until your throat bleeds. No one comes.

The air gets thin.

You pass out, wondering if this is what the pledges felt.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Total black screen

public_embed.title: üíä The Dosage
public_embed.description:
You reach for your pills. But the bottle is wrong. The label says **"TRUTH"**.

You take it anyway.

The walls start to breathe. You see HIM. The Pale King, standing in the mirror.

He offers you a mask.
public_embed.captionOfImage: A face in a mirror that isn't yours, wearing a yellow crown, distorted reality

public_embed.title: üëë Analysis Complete
public_embed.description:
You put on the mask. Suddenly, the world makes sense.

Time is a flat circle. You've done this before. You'll do it again.

You giggle. It's not a nervous giggle. It's a hungry one.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Abstract spiral symbol glowing yellow on a black background

public_embed.title: üß† Clarity
public_embed.description:
You smash the glass. Hand bleeding. The hallucination ends.

You're not crazy. Touched, maybe. But not crazy.

You know what needs to be done.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Shard of mirror reflecting a frightened eye

public_embed.title: ü§ù Opportunity
public_embed.description:
It's just the two of you inside. The Ex-Cop and the Heir.

**Ex-Cop:** "The Fixer is a liability. The Shrink is insane."
**Heir:** "We could blame them. Say they killed the others."

Do you frame your friends to save yourselves?
public_embed.captionOfImage: Two silhouettes whispering conspiratorially in dim light

public_embed.title: üìù The New Narrative
public_embed.description:
"History is written by the winners," the Heir says.

You start planting evidence against the Fixer. It's easy.
public_embed.captionOfImage: Globed hands planting a knife

public_embed.title: üõ°Ô∏è The Code
public_embed.description:
The Ex-Cop shakes his head. "I don't rat on my own people. Not even the broken ones."

You decide to go find them.
public_embed.captionOfImage: A tarnished police badge sitting on a table

public_embed.title: üî´ The Pale King Arrives
public_embed.description:
You all stumble into the main hall. Muddy. Bleeding. High.

The front door opens. A figure steps in wearing the antlered mask of the Pale King.

He takes off the mask.

It's **Father Blackwood**. The dead cult leader. He didn't die. He's been waiting.
public_embed.captionOfImage: A gaunt old man holding a terrifying deer-skull mask, framed by lightning

public_embed.title: üîö The Final Choice
public_embed.description:
**Father Blackwood:** "My children. You've suffered enough. Join me again, or die like dogs."

**The Ex-Cop** raises his gun.
**The Heir** looks at the Ex-Cop.
**The Fixer** looks at the floor.
**The Shrink** looks at the ceiling.
public_embed.captionOfImage: First person view of a revolver barrel aimed at the old man, hands shaking

public_embed.title: üö¨ The Tax Man
public_embed.description:
BANG.

Blackwood drops. The Ex-Cop smokes the barrel.

"Debt paid," he says.

You burn the lodge down. You walk away. The darkness is still there, but you're not carrying it alone anymore.

**Ending: The Clean Slate**
public_embed.captionOfImage: Four figures walking away from a massive inferno, backs to the camera, slow motion style

public_embed.title: üëë Long Live The King
public_embed.description:
BANG. BANG. BANG.

Three bodies hit the floor. The Survivor kneels.

Father Blackwood smiles. "Welcome home."

Time is a flat circle.

**Ending: The New Circle**
public_embed.captionOfImage: Pools of blood on wooden floorboards forming a ritual symbol

public_embed.title: ‚öñÔ∏è The Truth
public_embed.description:
You drop the guns. You call the cops.

You all go to jail. For a long time.

But for the first time in 15 years... you sleep soundly.

**Ending: Penance**
public_embed.captionOfImage: Sunlight streaming through iron bars, peaceful dust motes
